record.title: CREATING LONG-TERM ENERGY ALTERNATIVES FOR THE NATION ACT OF 2007--MOTION TO PROCEED--Continued
record.chair: Under the previous order, pursuant to rule XXII, the Chair lays before the Senate the pending cloture motion. The clerk will report the motion to invoke cloture.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
record.chair: By unanimous consent, the mandatory quorum call has been waived.
record.narrative: The clerk will call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: I announce that the Senator from Indiana (Mr. BAYH), the Senator from Delaware (Mr. BIDEN), the Senator from Connecticut (Mr. DODD), the Senator from South Dakota (Mr. JOHNSON), and the Senator from Illinois (Mr. OBAMA) are necessarily absent.
The following Senators are necessarily absent: the Senator from Kansas (Mr. Brownback), the Senator from Oklahoma (Mr. Coburn), and the Senator from Arizona (Mr. McCain).

record.chair: Are there any other Senators in the Chamber desiring to vote?
record.narrative: The yeas and nays resulted--yeas 91, nays 0, as follows:
record.chair: On this vote, the yeas are 91, the nays are zero. Three-fifths of the Senators duly chosen and sworn having voted in the affirmative, the motion is agreed to.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
